byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa reported from Sana, and Kareem Fahim from Mecca, Saudi Arabia.
byline.original: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Houthi rebels in Yemen accuse Saudi Arabia of inciting unrest to divide the country.
lead_paragraph: The leader of the Houthi rebel group accused Saudi Arabia, Yemen’s powerful neighbor, of financing armed opponents and trying to divide the country.

headline.main: Rebels Accuse Saudis of Fueling Unrest to Divide Yemen
headline.print_headline: Rebels Accuse Saudis of Inciting Unrest to Divide Yemen

snippet: The leader of the Houthi rebel group accused Saudi Arabia, Yemen’s powerful neighbor, of financing armed opponents and trying to divide the country.
